title: BBC Local Live: Coventry and Warwickshire - BBC News
summary: cladding on two coventry tower blocks .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: watch : your weekend weather forecast for the west midlands
text: here 's how your weekend 's going to start in the west midlands on the weather front .
keep yourself updated over the next two days with the bbc weather website .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: government funding to improve roads
text: the government has announced a £ 282m upgrade for major roads and motorways in the midlands .
improvements include work on the m42 at junction six to help ease congestion on and off the a45 , better access to birmingham airport and preparations for the new hs2 station .
ministers say the extra money will help the region 's economy grow .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: delays of over an hour on the m42
text: drivers on the m42 northbound are warned to expect delays of more than an hour after an accident closed several lanes of the carriageway .
there are delays between junction 2 and junction 3a ( earlswood ) as a large spillage is cleared .
diversions are in place
1 lane open # m42 n/b btwn j3 ( # reditch ) + j3a ( # m40 ) @ twitterid specialist crew on route to clear large spillage

documents.title: burst main affects hospital water supply
text: burst main affects hospital water supply

documents.title: tottenham and man city enter checkatrade trophy
text: manchester city and tottenham will be among the youth teams who will be trying to follow in the sky blues ' footsteps and win the checkatrade trophy next season .
they are among the new clubs who will play .
premier league champions chelsea will also enter an under-21 side , as they did last season , but manchester united , arsenal and liverpool have turned down the chance to participate .
coventry manager mark robins ( above ) says new signing michael doyle is in with a chance of being named the club captain for the coming season .
robins says his experience having rejoined the club will be crucial .
the experience we brought in , certainly michael doyle , i think he 's gon na help a lot of the younger players here .
we [ have ] still got a core nucleus of younger players as well . ''

documents.title: your photos : offchurch
text: g man sent us this photo of offchurch .
you can get involved with bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: work to restore water after leak affects hospital site
text: a warwickshire hospital says a bypass has been installed to allow it to get water while a ruptured pipe is repaired .
the problem happened near the main entrance to hospital of st cross in rugby shortly after 09:00 .
a spokesperson for the hospital trust has also said patient care had not been affected and patients `` should attend their appointments as normal , following road diversions as appropriate '' .
the spokesperson said earlier : `` we can confirm that we are aware of a major water leak on barby road , which has affected the site at the hospital of st cross .
`` severn trent have installed a bypass which is temporarily allowing water to the site .
we are currently working with severn trent and the highways agency to restore normal levels of water to the site .
we are currently monitoring the water supply and reserve tanks at the site to ensure that the water supply is meeting demand . ''
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: notorious coventry junction being revamped as part of £ 700,000 project
text: a notorious coventry gyratory is being revamped in a bid to help shake its 'malfunction junction ' moniker .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: 'stay in there ' advice over high-rise flat fires
text: coventry city council says it is sticking with `` stay put '' advice for people in high-rise flats in the event of fire .
it stipulates residents should remain where they are if fire breaks out in their block - unless , that is , they 're told to leave by firefighters .
andrew walster from the local authority said the advice was based on everyone 's safety .

rather than having lots of people trying to exit a building , when you have the fire service trying to get into the building with their hoses etc etc to fight the fire and not cause it to spread , it is better that people stay in there , but they absolutely repeated if people want to get out , then they should get out . ''
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: police overtime spending cut
text: police in warwickshire and west mercia managed to cut the amount they spent on overtime last year , but it remained over £ 4.5m , despite cuts to police numbers .
since 2010 , the average spending on overtime for the two forces has been £ 5.3m , reaching a peak of over £ 6m in 2011-12 .
since the partnership of the two forces , the number of police officers has fallen by around a quarter , but until last year spending on overtime had remained over £ 5m a year .

documents.title: ex-wife of former liberian president faces torture charges in court
text: the ex-wife of former liberian president charles taylor has appeared in court accused of torture offences linked to the country 's civil war .
agnes reeves taylor , 51 , ( above in the early 1990s ) faces six charges relating to alleged offences committed in the west african country between 1989 and 1991 .
she appeared at the old bailey on friday via video link from hmp bronzefield in surrey , where she is being held on remand .
she spoke only to confirm her identity and acknowledge she understood what had been said in court .
reeves taylor , a lecturer and head of department at coventry university , faces five charges of torture and one of conspiracy to torture , the court heard .
the defendant , of kitchener road , dagenham , east london , was remanded in custody ahead of a further preliminary hearing at the same court on 20 july .

documents.title: robins looking to bring in fresh players
text: coventry city boss mark robins says he 's still looking to bring in fresh players ahead of the new season .
he 's so far added eight players to the squad as they aim to get out of league two at the first attempt .
it 's back to training for the sky blues .
they 'll play sutton united in a pre-season friendly in eight days ' time .
we 're just sort of reshaping things and trying to get a good balance .

so there 's a lot of hard work gone on and obviously we 've , i think , brought some good players in and that 'll be borne out i 'm sure during the season but [ there 's ] still quite a bit of work to do yet . ''
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: adrian edmondson joining rsc for twelfth night
text: the comedian and actor adrian edmondson is joining the rsc for its production of twelfth night .
edmondson ( above ) will play malvolio with the former eastenders star kara tointon playing olivia .
the run starts at the royal shakespeare theatre in november .
author: Alec Blackman
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: drug smuggler jailed for 10 years
text: a drug smuggler has been jailed for 10 years after trafficking cocaine to criminal groups around the country , the national crime agency ( nca ) says .
adrini kuqi , 31 , supplied criminal groups - according to the nca - with more than 50kg of the class a drug .
having pleaded guilty at birmingham crown court , kuqi , of new king street , london , received the ten-year term along with a concurrent one-year prison sentence for money laundering .
the nca said warwickshire police officers , working with the agency , stopped his car on the m42 south of birmingham .
drugs in the car and a house had a street value of about £ 1.2m , the nca added .

documents.title: coventry defender haynes agrees new deal
text: coventry defender haynes agrees new deal

documents.title: great britain 's men in wheelchair rugby european championships semi-finals
text: great britain 's men have reached the semi-finals of the wheelchair rugby european championships .
the team includes former coventry student jim roberts , who had both of his legs amputated after contracting bacterial meningitis .

documents.title: new coventry city ceo 'ambassador for club '
text: the sky blues ' new chief executive officer says engaging with supporters is a key part of the job .
dave boddy has taken over the role after similar spells at worcester city and newport county .
i 've always had a policy that within reason i 'll try and deal on a one-to-one basis with any query i get from supporters .
i 'm always open to engaging with them whether it be in forums , one-to-one email communication .
i see my role as being an ambassador for the club and that 's an important part of it . ''

documents.title: water company has 'isolated problem ' at hospital
text: severn trent says it has `` isolated the problem '' after water was lost at hospital of st cross in rugby .
a spokesperson said : `` we have engineers working outside [ the site ] to repair a water pipe that burst this morning .
we 've isolated the problem and water supplies should now start returning for any customers that were affected in the area .
`` we 're sorry for any inconvenience this has caused and we 'll now work as quickly as possible to get the pipe repaired . ''

documents.title: patients told to check appointments with hospital after water lost
text: police have asked members of the public to check with hospital of st cross in rugby to confirm appointments after water was lost there earlier due to a burst main .
according to officers , water is `` now being taken on site slowly '' .

documents.title: 'no water at hospital '
text: water was lost at hospital of st cross in rugby earlier due to a burst main , police say .
a road was shut between the entrance to the day surgery unit and main car park , with the closure set to remain , police said , due to surface damage .

documents.title: your photos : coventry
text: kingfisher whisperer has sent in this photo of coventry .
you can also get involved at bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'metro mayor ' trying to win business backing
text: the mayor of the west midlands has been trying to win business backing for his vision for the region over the next four years .
andy street has been in nuneaton talking to 60 firms , including holland & barrett and triton showers .
he said while the borough council there was n't a full member of the region 's combined authority , he was determined that local firms would n't be left behind .
it 's nothing to do with being eclipsed .
it 's actually all about working together .
if you think how people move between the different places for their jobs , where investment comes from , that 's how the total economy works . ''

documents.title: 'just two wm housing tower blocks in coventry have cladding '
text: coventry city council says that two residential blocks which have cladding do not use the type found at grenfell tower in london .
the authority says the cladding on the west midlands housing group pair is of a higher quality .
councillors were told at a meeting last night every block in the city had been inspected twice and would get a third inspection by west midlands fire service .
cladding fitted to grenfell tower during its refurbishment was changed to a cheaper version , documents obtained by the bbc suggest .
andrew walster from coventry city council said he was satisfied the blocks were as fire safe as they could be .
we have no cladding on residential blocks in coventry which is the same as the cladding in grenfell .
we have cladding on two west midlands housing group buildings and we 're reassured that that cladding is of a much higher quality and a much higher fire-retardant quality than that in london . ''
author: Alec Blackman
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: luxury leamington retirement village expansion plans get go ahead
text: plans to build luxury retirement apartments on the site of a former leamington care home have been approved .
author: Warwick Courier

documents.title: 'driverless ' car trial comes to coventry
text: people in coventry are being asked how they feel about 'driverless ' cars today ahead of a city-wide trial .
millions of pounds are being spent to test the system over the next two and a half years .
researchers at university of warwick will be speaking to local people at the city 's transport museum today .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: cricket : warwickshire stay bottom of league
text: warwickshire are still bottom of the cricket county championship after their hopes for a first win of the season were washed away yesterday .
rain meant the bears had to settle for a draw against lancashire at edgbaston , but coach jim troughton says they can take some positives .
we know we have n't been up to our best , but it was a good day to take 10 wickets .
we had to think outside the box to take those wickets . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: pigs filmed in 'bleak ' conditions
text: an investigation is under way after an animal rights group released footage they said showed pigs in overcrowded conditions at a farm .
images filmed at hogwood farm in warwickshire by viva allegedly showed pigs in cramped sheds , while some sick animals had no access to food or water .
the animal and plant health agency said it would investigate the footage .
a farm spokesman said it would review procedures , but insisted it complied with all animal welfare standards .

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast
text: after a rather cloudy , but generally dry start , some patchy rain is likely this afternoon .
find out what the weather has in store for the weekend .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: good morning from coventry and warwickshire live .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather until 18:00 .
you can get in touch and comment by emailing us , tweeting , or visiting our facebook page .

documents.title: pigs filmed in 'bleak ' conditions
text: pigs filmed in 'bleak ' conditions

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on friday .
keep an eye out here for more updates and breaking news before then .

documents.title: tip off leads to cannabis plant find
text: more than 200 cannabis plants were seized from a property in coleshill following a tip-off , police say .
two men were arrested at the property on coleshill industrial estate , station road , and two cars were also seized .
further searches were also made at three addresses outside of the warwickshire area , where items and a further three vehicles were seized .

a 32-year-old man from birmingham , a 35-year-old woman and a 27-year-old man , both from solihull , have all been arrested and released under investigation on sus of production of a controlled drug .

documents.title: us couple returns wwi soldier 's postcard
text: us couple returns wwi soldier 's postcard

documents.title: coventry city 's new chief announced
text: coventry city has confirmed that dave boddy , who joined as the club 's commercial director in february , will be the new chief executive .
he 'll be responsible for the club 's day-to-day running from immediate effect .
his priorities , he said , would be to develop commercial opportunities at the club as well as improving engagement with community , supporters and stakeholders .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: pig farm 'reviewing ' practices after animal rights group claims
text: a warwickshire farm said it 's reviewing it 's practices after an animal rights group released they said showed overcrowding and bad conditions at a pig unit .

viva said showed `` some of the worst conditions they 'd seen '' but a spokesperson on behalf of farmer brian hobill from hogwood farm in oxhill said that the `` well established business '' was `` audited on a regular basis . ''
it would be `` reviewing practices , '' the spokesman added .
the rspca said it was `` concerned '' about the welfare of some of the pigs in the footage but the conditions appear to be `` compliant with legal requirement '' .
the animal and plant health agency said it takes potential breaches of welfare legislation very seriously and investigates all allegations .

documents.title: weather : a cloudy and wet end to the week
text: we 're forecast cloud , rain and some blustery wind tomorrow , but it could be improving slightly over the weekend .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: public transport hate crime figures released
text: there have been 63 incidents of hate crime recorded on the rail network in the west midlands since january , says british transport police .
the figures show that violence and public order offences are the most reported crimes , with most of them taking place on a saturday or weekday evening .
birmingham had the most incidents with 41 being recorded since january , followed by 11 in coventry .
there were 9 complaints recorded in wolverhampton and two in rugby .
the figures have been released to coincide with the # westandtogether campaign , launched to tackle hate crimes and hate incidents on public transport .

documents.title: ww1 soldier 's returned home
text: a framed portrait of a first world war soldier is to be returned to birmingham , after it was bought years ago and taken to america .
the image is of lieutenant william henry furse , who was killed on the first day of the battle of the somme .
an american couple on holiday in stratford-upon-avon bought the frame in a shop and later discovered a newspaper cutting announcing william 's marriage and a postcard hidden behind the
they made contact with the moseley local history society who put together the rest of the jigsaw and have come up with william furse 's full story .
the frame will be handed over to the society today and they are now planning a future exhibition about this ww1 soldier from moseley .

documents.title: no wimbledon singles for marcus willis
text: marcus willis 's hopes of playing in the wimbledon singles are over .
he 's been beaten by illya marchenko .

documents.title: fire safety works continue at £ 380m hospital
text: the trust that runs coventry 's university hospital has completed `` a significant proportion '' of fire prevention work at the site , but still has not completed it .
a safety review revealed the £ 380m hospital , which opened in 2006 , may have been constructed without adequate fire protection , the trust said last year .
university hospitals coventry and warwickshire nhs trust said it was still working on a plan to fire-proof some areas that `` are difficult to access '' .
a programme of remedial works started in autumn 2015 to ensure that all of the penetrations through compartmental walls are appropriately sealed .
a significant proportion of the remedial works have now been completed and we are currently developing a plan to address the remaining areas that are proving difficult to access .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rain forces draw in bears-lancs game
text: rain forces draw in bears-lancs game

documents.title: sky blue view wins culture competition
text: an image of runners at the start of this year 's coventry half marathon has won a competition supported by the city of culture bid team .
the eyes on cov competition gave amateur photographers the chance to take from height , thanks to local commercial property company the wigley group .
winning snapper , si chun lam 's shot , overlooking millennium place was taken from a cherry- and encompasses the whittle arches , along with coventry 's spires and new development in the area .
it was quite overcast so once i 'd taken the i had the idea to bring out the blue which seemed appropriate as coventry is a sky blue city .
it was a brilliant experience as i would n't normally get the opportunity to take a photo like that . ''

documents.title: police probe into fox death dropped
text: on our front page this week : a police investigation launched after a pack of hunting dogs were captured savaging a fox to death near tamworth has been dropped by officers , it has been revealed
author: Atherstone & Coleshill Herald

documents.title: coventry city academy to remain at coventry centre for another season
text: the sky blues academy is to stay at the alan higgs centre in coventry for the coming year , the club has announced .
coventry had warned the academy would be under threat after wasps rugby club got permission for a new training facility at the centre .
a deal with the coventry sports foundation , who run the site , been agreed after wasps said they were delaying building their new training base at the site .
the club said they will now stay there until the end of next season with talks about a long-term re-location on-going .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: overnight closure for ring road improvements
text: there will be a full overnight closure of the coventry ring road , travelling clockwise between junctions one and three , between 20:00 and 06:00 .
improvements to the area , known as swanswell viaduct , are due to continue until the end of september .
there will be a full overnight closure travelling clockwise from junction 1 to 3 from 8pm tonight to 6am tomorrow

documents.title: taxi drivers trained to prevent child sexual exploitation
text: all people applying for a taxi licence in rugby will have to complete training on how to spot child sexual exploitation .
a trial saw 94 % of the area 's existing taxis drivers undergo the voluntary training and now councillors are making it mandatory for all taxi and private hire drivers .

documents.title: wimbledon 2017 : marcus wilis one match away from wimbledon singles
text: marcus willis will meet ukranian ninth seed illya marchenko at roehampton later on today , for a place in wimbledon 's main draw .
willis , 26 , came through three rounds of pre-qualifying , three rounds of qualifying and the first-round proper at the all england club last year , before losing to federer on centre court .
asked what it would mean to qualify for the singles competiton , willis said : `` everything .
i 'm just trying to keep my head down and prove i should be there again . ''
he will definitely be at wimbledon again this year as he has received a wildcard for the doubles .

documents.title: driver cut free through roof after curdworth crash
text: fire crews cut through the roof of a car to free a man after a collision in curdworth last night .
ambulance staff say they treated the man , believed to be in his 30s , for mulitple injuries after he was trapped for around 35 minutes .
he was eventually taken to hospital after the crash which happened shortly before 23:05 on the fairview industrial estate on kingsbury road .

documents.title: man found with 6,000 child abuse images jailed
text: a nuneaton man has been jailed for a year after being found with more than 6,000 child abuse images , some of which were graded as the most serious .
ian parrot , 49 , of freer street , nuneaton , admitted three counts of making indecent images and one of possessing a prohibited image .
police say the images of `` real children suffering from real harm and horrendous abuse '' were saved on a number of laptops and storage devices seized from parrot 's home .
he was given a sexual harm prevention order and will be placed on the sex offender register for ten years .

documents.title: consultation into children 's centres launched
text: plans to change the way 12 children 's centres in warwickshire operate have been put out to public consultation by the county council .
under the plans 12 centres for 0-5 year-olds would be turned into `` family hubs '' offering services for 0-19 year-olds .

but the future of the remaining 27 centres is uncertain with the council saying it will `` explore any opportunities within the local community and providers to continue to offer services '' at these centres .
the council says it 's changing the way it does things because it needs to make £ 67m of overall savings by 2020 .

documents.title: university offers pay-as-you-learn online degrees
text: coventry university has launched a range of fully online postgraduate degrees in collaboration with the social learning company futurelearn .
distance learners across the globe will be able to access 50 degrees , which will roll out over the next five years .
short pathway courses will be offered free-of-charge with degrees available on a pay-as-you-go basis , the university says , to make learning `` manageable and flexible '' .

for coventry , the growth of our online programmes will be a catalyst to revolutionise the way we teach at our university , with possibilities emerging for bite-sized learning for those with busy lives , and free modules for those who want to try before committing to study .

documents.title: coventry mp secures position in private members ' bill draw
text: coventry north west mp , geoffrey robinson , has been given the chance to be one of the first mps to propose a new law , in an annual ballot .
the result of the private members ' bill draw puts the labour mp in sixth position to get parliamentary time allocated for debate .
a total of 20 mps ' names were drawn with labour mp chris bryant coming first meaning he will get the most parliamentary time .
some 461 mps entered the ballot , which was drawn by a commons clerk and announced by deputy speaker lindsay hoyle .

documents.title: cricket : final day of county championship for warwickshire
text: warwickshire go into the final day of their county championship match with lancashire still with a good chance of their first win of the season .
lancashire resume on 178 for four in their second innings , 130 runs ahead .
bears bowler rikki clarke told bbc wm he thinks they `` stand a real chance '' .
author: BBC WM Sport

documents.title: cuts to stroke beds spart outrage
text: on our front page this week : warwick hospital is to lose all stroke services and patients sent to coventry under new plans .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: council approves masterplan for warwick land
text: a new hotel could be built on st mary 's lands in warwick under plans which were passed last night .
a cycle link from hampton road to saltisford brook , a new play area and a new entrance to the racecourse were all approved by councillors .
following a feasibility study on the economic benefits of a hotel , a report on the proposal will be brought before councillors later this year .

documents.title: stroke unit at nuneaton hospital to be downgraded
text: the nuneaton news can reveal that there are plans to change the current acute stroke service at the george eliot hospital in nuneaton .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: british and irish lions : johnny sexton and owen farrell start in second test
text: wasps ' elliot daly will start for the british and irish lions , in the second test against new zealand in wellington .
for the first time the combination of england 's owen farrell and ireland 's jonny sexton will start on the tour .
captain sam warburton replaces peter o'mahony on the blind-side flank , with maro itoje preferred to george kruis .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: city tb rates above average in region
text: coventry has one of the worst rates for tuberculosis cases in the west midlands , according to the latest figures .
only birmingham and sandwell have higher rates according to data published by public health england .
they suggest that despite vaccination programmes targeting the most at-risk areas , the city has an average of 27 cases per 100,000 people ,
the average across the region is 14 and 12 across england .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: wellesbourne allotment holders fight housing plans
text: green-fingered villagers are ready to fight back after it was revealed homes could be built on wellesbourne allotments .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: ndlovu : i 'd give my zimbabwe shirt to mugabe
text: ndlovu : i 'd give my zimbabwe shirt to mugabe

documents.title: wimbledon 2017 : marcus willis beats liam broady in qualifying
text: marcus willis is one match from qualifying for wimbledon for the second year running after beating fellow briton liam broady .
willis , who eventually lost to roger federer in last year 's second round , won 7-6 ( 7-2 ) 6-7 ( 7-2 ) 6-2 .
after dominating the tie-break to clinch the first set , willis - ranked seven places below broady at 374 - fought back from a break down in the second .
broady , 23 , saved three match points in game 10 and forced a decider only to drop serve early in the final set with a loose game .
with the light fading , willis broke again to lead 5-2 and converted his fourth match point .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: video : what 's the weather got in store today ?
text: a cloudy and overcast day with outbreaks of rain an drizzle with highs of around 15c ( 59f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area on the bbc weather site .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: good morning from coventry and warwickshire live .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather until 18:00 .
you can get in touch and comment by emailing us , tweeting , or visiting our facebook page .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lancs set up last-day contest with bears
text: lancs set up last-day contest with bears
author: Stephan Shemilt
BBC Sport

documents.title: tower block panels fail fire safety test
text: tower block panels fail fire safety test

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday .
keep an eye out here for more updates and breaking news before then .

documents.title: how did she die ? mystery after body of mum found in coventry lake
text: mystery surrounds the discovery of a woman 's body in a coventry lake late at night .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: missing coventry woman failed to turn up to meet brother
text: police are appealing for any information on the whereabouts of tracey montgomery who has been reported missing from coventry .
the 35-year-old was last seen on friday 16 june when she 'd planned to meet up with her brother the next day but failed to show up .
more recently tracey had long black hair , but may have dyed it back red .
if anyone has information , call pc brown on 101 ext 834 3018 .

documents.title: tax driver 'helping ' with inquiries , police say
text: the driver of a taxi which hit a 32-year-old man in leamington is assisting with inquiries , police say .
the collision took place on the a425 at the junction of old warwick road .
emergency services attended the scene but were unable to save the pedestrian .
police are now appealing for witnesses .
author: Lisa Wright
Journalist, BBC News Online
